titles.title: Providing for the consideration of the bill (H.R. 728) to control crime by providing enforcement block grants.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 104-27, by Ms. Pryce.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 728 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit. Bill is open to amendments. It shall be in order to consider as an original bill for the purpose of amendment the amendment in the nature of a substitute recommended by the Committee on the Judiciary now printed in the bill. During consideration of the bill for amendment, priority in recognition will be given on the basis of whether the amendment has been printed in the Congressional Record. The bill shall be considered for amendment for a period not to exceed 10 hours.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 15.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 2/10/1995--Introduced. Sets forth the modified open rule for the consideration of H.R. 728 (providing law enforcement block grants).
